member.name: T:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.FileListMap
member.summary:
Class to manage file list map file File list map file has following format: ((sentence id) (relatice path))+.
100001 Am_En101\100001 100002 Am_En101\100002.
Advantage of using file list map: 1) Group related files into same folder, and give the folder a meaningful label this make the data easy to understand and management 2) Can divide all files into many subdirs, this can speed up the file searching.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.FileListMap.MapToFolder(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Map filemap into folder indexing items For example, it will map following items 10001 ENU001\10001 10002 ENU001\10002 10003 ENU002\10003 Into ENU001 10001 10002 ENU002 10003.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.ScriptItem
member.summary:
Class represents one script item in transcript file This class is compatible of the two-line script An example of two-line item is:
100006 this was a good deal * #2 for citibank * #2 and for germany. dh . ih 1 . s / w . ax 1 . z / ax / g . uh 1 . d / d . iy 1 l / f . ao 1 r / s . ih 1 - t . iy - b . ae 2 ng . k / ae 1 n . d / f . ao 1 r / jh . er 1 r - m ax - n iy /.

member.summary: The appended string following the sentence ID.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.ScriptItem.SentenceDelimiter
member.summary: The appended string following the sentence ATTENTION: Do NOT use Environment.NewLine as the line break!!! Because it (\r\n) will be converted to "\n" in RichTextBox, and this Leads to the mismatch between ScriptItem.cs and ScriptItemBox.cs.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.ScriptFile
member.summary:
Definition of Script file. Data format: ((sentence id) (sentence content)(\n)(sentence pronunciation))+.
104281 on wednesdays * after five p.m. aa 1 n / w eh 1 n . z - d . ey . z / ae 1 . f - t . ax r / f . ay 1 . v / p . iy 1 / eh 1 m /.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.ScriptFile.ValidatePronunciation(Microsoft.Tts.Offline.ScriptFile)
member.summary: Validate the phone sequence in the script file. It will check: 1) word alignment with the pronunciation string. This means that for each word it should have one and only one corresponding pronunciation 2) the pronunciation should be syllabified, and for each syllbale there is one and only one vowel. It can have one stress mark 3) each phones in the pronunciation string, should be valid in that langugage phoneme set.
member.param: The script oebjct to be validated.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.PosInSyllable
member.summary: Definition of position of unit at syllable level.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.PosInSyllable.Onset
member.summary: 0 First slice in syllable, usually consonant.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.PosInSyllable.OnsetNext
member.summary: 1 Next to first slice in syllable, usually consonant.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.PosInSyllable.NucleusInV
member.summary: 2 Middle slice in sllable, usually vowel, Must has no Onset and no Coda in syllable.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.PosInSyllable.NucleusInVC
member.summary: 2 Middle slice in sllable, usually vowel, Must has no Onset but with Coda in syllable.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.PosInSyllable.NucleusInCV
member.summary: 2 Middle slice in sllable, usually vowel Must has Onset but with no Coda in syllable.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.PosInSyllable.NucleusInCVC
member.summary: 2 Middle slice in sllable, usually vowel Must has both Onset and Coda in syllable.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.PosInSyllable.CodaNext
member.summary: 3 Previous to last slice in syllable, usually consonant.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.PosInSyllable.Coda
member.summary: 4 Last slice in syllable, usually consonant.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.PosInWord
member.summary: Definition of position of syllable at word level. It describes the position information of slice/unit Through the syllable it belongs to.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.PosInWord.Head
member.summary: 0 At head position.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.PosInWord.Middle
member.summary: 1 In the middle of word.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.PosInWord.Tail
member.summary: 2 At tail position.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.PosInWord.Mono
member.summary: 3 This word is mono-syllable word.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.PosInSentence
member.summary: Definition of position of word in sentence level. This types are defined through preceding and following break level of the word. Left break level and right break level.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.PosInSentence.L1R1
member.summary: 0 Left break level 1, right break level 1.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.PosInSentence.L2R1
member.summary: 1 Left break level 2, right break level 1.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.PosInSentence.L34R1
member.summary: 2 Left break level 3/4, right break level 1.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.PosInSentence.L1R2
member.summary: 3 Left break level 1, right break level 2.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.PosInSentence.L2R2
member.summary: 4 Left break level 2, right break level 2.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.PosInSentence.L34R2
member.summary: 5 Left break level 3/4, right break level 2.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.PosInSentence.L1R3
member.summary: 6 Left break level 1, right break level 3.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.PosInSentence.L1R4
member.summary: 7 Left break level 1, right break level 4.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.PosInSentence.L2R3
member.summary: 8 Left break level 2, right break level 3.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.PosInSentence.L2R4
member.summary: 9 Left break level 2, right break level 4.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.PosInSentence.L34R34
member.summary: 10 Left break level 3/4, right break level 3/4.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.PosInSentence.Quest
member.summary: 11 This is question mark.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.TtsStress
member.summary: Definition of stress level for syllable.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.TtsStress.None
member.summary: 0 Not stress level appied.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.TtsStress.Primary
member.summary: 1 Primary stress level.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.TtsStress.Secondary
member.summary: 2 Second stress level.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.TtsStress.Tertiary
member.summary: 3 Third stress level.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.TtsEmphasis
member.summary: Definition of Emphasis.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.TtsEmphasis.None
member.summary: 0 No emphasis applied.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.TtsEmphasis.Yes
member.summary: 1 Apply emphasis.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.TtsBreak
member.summary: Break.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.TtsBreak.Phone
member.summary: 0 Phone.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.TtsBreak.Syllable
member.summary: 1 Break level 1.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.TtsBreak.Word
member.summary: 2 Between words.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.TtsBreak.InterPhrase
member.summary: 3 Between prosodic phrases.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.TtsBreak.IntonationPhrase
member.summary: 4 Between ntonation phrases.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.TtsBreak.Sentence
member.summary: 5 Between sentence.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.TtsWordTone
member.summary: Break.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.TtsWordTone.Continue
member.summary: 0, c, no perceptual pitch movement at the boundary.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.TtsWordTone.FullRise
member.summary: 1, R, a clear pitch excursion into the higher portion of The speakers pitch range, as at the end of A typical American English yes/no question.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.TtsWordTone.MinorRise
member.summary: 2, r, A minor, yet, perceptible pitch excursion up at a phrase boundary.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.TtsWordTone.FullFall
member.summary: 3, F, a clear pitch excursion into the lower portion of The speakers pitch range, as at the end of A typical American English declarative statement .

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.TtsWordTone.MinorFall
member.summary: 4, f, A minor, yet, perceptible pitch excursion down at a phrase boundary.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.TtsWordTone.StrictRise
member.summary: 5, A strict rise, in the word tone prediction of the run-time engine, The last word of question sentence will be set to strict rise.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.TtsWordTone.StrictFall
member.summary: 6, A strict fall, in the word tone prediction of the run-time engine, The last word of non-question sentence will be set to strict fall.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.TtsTobiAccent
member.summary: Tobi Accent.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.TtsTobiAccent.NoAccent
member.summary: 0, for non accent.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.TtsTobiAccent.HighStar
member.summary: 1, for H*.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.TtsTobiAccent.LowStar
member.summary: 2, for L*.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.TtsTobiAccent.LowStarHigh
member.summary: 3, for L*+H (late rise).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.TtsTobiAccent.RisingStar
member.summary: 4, for Rising Step? (Not clear, just followed TTS_TOBI_ACCENT in ttsdatadef.h);.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.TtsTobiAccent.LowHighStar
member.summary: 5, for L+H* (early rise).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.TtsTobiAccent.DownHighStar
member.summary: 6, for down step? Not clear, just followed TTS_TOBI_ACCENT in ttsdatadef.h);.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.Core.PronunciationError.VowelAndSonorantCountLessThanMinimumForSingleSyllableWord
member.summary: Vowel plus sonorant count less than minimum {0} : pronunciation {1} : Minimum of vowel plus sonorant Count.
member.remarks: In lexicon pronunciation, some languages may have less than minimum vowel and sonorant in one syllable if the word has only one syllable , such as "h m" of word "hm" in enIN, "s" of prefix word "c'" in frCA , we'll not remove these words from lexicon, just report this issue as warning.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.Localor.LoadResource(Microsoft.Tts.Offline.Language,System.String)
member.summary:
LoadResource will look for resource in the following order:
1. Try to load resorce from customized path explicitly set by tools.
2. Load embedded resource files, most of which are referenced to latest data path.
3. Use stocked resources files as the last resort.
member.returns: Stream reader pointing to the found resource, null if not found.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.TruncateRuleData.NucleusTruncateRules
member.summary:
Gets Since the size of core nucleus set is always limited, so we need Truncate phone into a core nucleus slice plus other marginal Mono-phones [sonorant *] core nucleus slice [sonorant *]
The rule will guide what kind of phone to truncate, and how it is Truncated, like left-side first or right-side first.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.SliceData
member.summary:
This syllable can be abstracted as a consonant-vowel-consonant Syllable, abbreviated CVC.In the one-syllable English word cat, The nucleus is a, the onset c, the coda t, and the rime at.
The basic idea of defining slice is to join some phone clusters, Which are not easy to be separated or frequently used, into one unit. Such a joining operation is bounded to syllable boundaries.
Slice is a set of atom units with the size between phone and syllable.
Here to address the problem, combining those phones hard to Be separated or frequently used. [sonorant *] xx [sonorant *] xx denotes a vowel.

member.param: Slice string should be the same format with the ones in array: _nucleusTruncateRules, _unsetTruncateRules, _codaTruncateRules. For example : a+t1+b The slice contains phone and tone.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.ManuAlignAdapter
member.summary:
Class to adapt manu-alignment segment data to well-labeled segment data. To speed up manu-alignment, vender will use simplest symbols to represent Each phones during segmentation. This module will recover this to well-labeled.
Vender re-aligns all the segments in the segment data. He/she can only insert or delete Silence segments in original automatic alignment data, and keeps all other segments.
Given script entry: 100001 american. ax - m eh 1 - r ax - k . ax n / Raw manual alignment data, deliveried by vender: 0.00000 sp 0.25800 a 0.37960 a 0.54910 a 0.70830 a 0.76960 a 0.91630 sp Based on forced alignment: 0.00000 sil 0.28000 ax 0.38000 m+eh 0.55000 r+ax 0.71000 k 0.76000 ax+n 0.92000 sil Adapted result as: 0.00000 sil 0.25800 ax 0.37960 m+eh 0.54910 r+ax 0.70830 k 0.76960 ax+n 0.91630 sil.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.ManuAlignAdapter.Adapt(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adapt raw manual alignment data to well-labeled alignment data.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.ManuAlignAdapter.RemoveSilenceSegment(System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection{Microsoft.Tts.Offline.WaveSegment})
member.summary: Remove all silence segment in the segment collection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.ManuAlignAdapter.Adapting(System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection{Microsoft.Tts.Offline.WaveSegment},System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection{Microsoft.Tts.Offline.WaveSegment},System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adapt certain segment file for one sentence.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.WaveUnit.ParseUntFile(System.String)
member.summary:
Parse text line in wave segment sequence file, usual WaveSegSeq.vec
The definitions of each column are listed as following:
(sentence id) (unit index in sentence) (sample offset in sentence) (sample length) (epoch offset) (epoch length) (8K compressed epoch length) (16K compressed epoch length) (relative path) (unit name)
MNNO0001CD1 0 25998 1514 162 15 16 15 MNNO0001CD1 ax MNNO0001CD1 1 27512 3050 177 36 36 36 MNNO0001CD1 m+eh MNNO0001CD1 2 30562 1800 213 29 30 29 MNNO0001CD1 r+ax.
member.param: Line in wave segment sequence file.

member.summary: Gets Configuration schema.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.Config.ForcedAlignConfig.TraceLevel
member.summary:
Gets or sets Value to indicate trace level of the HTK tools.
It is 0 by default.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.Config.ForcedAlignConfig.PruneLevel
member.summary:
Gets or sets Value to indicate -t level of the HVite.exe
It is 0 by default.
This property will define "-t" parameter for triphone HVite: Level -1 and 0: 400; level 1: 800; level 2: 1200 In SD approach, this affects monophone HVite, too: Level -1: 1000; level 0: 2000; level 1 and 2: no -t.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.Config.ForcedAlignConfig.OutputDir
member.summary: Gets or sets Output directory path, there will be some kind of output data generated. 1. Filemap.exe, this file list map is generated from the waveform 16k dir 2. Script.xml, this script file is generated from the script dir 3. SliceSegment directory, this directory contains the phonetic alignment result 4. Intermediate directory, this directory contains some internal data.

member.summary: Bit mask for shifting 32-bit data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.BitStream._buffer
member.summary: Store bitstream data for writting or reading.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.BitStream._index
member.summary: Current offset in _buffer when writting or reading.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.BitStream._cache
member.summary: 1. For writting data, firstly bits will be put into _cache till the _cache is fullfilled, at that time, current 32-bit data in _cache will be written to _buffer. 2. For reading data, firstly bits will be get from _cache till the _cache is empty, at that time, next 32-bit data from _buffer will be read into _cache.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.BitStream._leftBits
member.summary: 1. For writting data, _leftBits means how many bits can be written into _cache. 2. For reading data, _leftBits means how many bits can be read from _cache.

member.summary: Stemmer file operation class, stemmer file contains information of different forms of words. This file is plain text file with unicode encoding. For example: reach'\t'reaches'\t'reaching'\t'reached react'\t'reacted'\t'reacting'\t'reacts.

member.summary: Phrase information in the phrase file, each phrase item represent one line in the phrase file. The columns are separated by tab ('\t') For example: absence of menstruation'\t'noun absence of middle ear'\t'noun absence of mind'\t'noun,unknown.

member.summary: Gets POS list of the phrase.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.IO.PhraseFile
member.summary: Phrase file operation class, phrase file contains information of phrases. This file is plain text file with unicode encoding. There are at least 2 columns in each line, the column separated by "tab" char ('\t'). The first column is the phrase, the words of the phrase separated by blank space. The second column is the candidate POS information of the phrase, there may be multiple POS. The poses is combined with ",". For example: absence of menstruation'\t'noun absence of middle ear'\t'noun absence of mind'\t'noun,unknown.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.Waveform.EggAcousticFeature.Envelope(System.Single[],System.Single[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Envelope first detects the positive and negative amplitude Envelopes. The sign of the waveform is determined by picking Envelope with highest energy. The sign of the input waveform Is changed in case it is negative. After this the negative Values are clipped to zero. FInally, the signal is rescaled So that it can be stored as a WAV file.
member.returns: True if positive waveform, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.Waveform.EggAcousticFeature.PosEnvelope(System.Single[],System.Single[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Envelope estimates the amplitude envelope of the input Signal. To do this an algorithm similar to a half-wave Rectification is used where the envelope tracks instant Increases in amplitude and then the envelope linearly decays After a small time. This is a fast method to estimate the Amplitude envelope. This routine will compute the positive Envelope (the negative pulses do not contribute).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.Waveform.EggAcousticFeature.RemoveCloseEpochs(System.Single[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Remove Epochs that are closer than the minimum pitch period. Set the positive epoch to zero if it following less then minPitchPeriod Coutt of non positive epoch.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.Waveform.EggAcousticFeature.HandleCutPoint(System.Int32[],System.Int32,System.Single[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: We could handle even/odd, but really it should be very stationary, And we're only doing integer offsets anyway, so it doesn't matter Then, insert a sample delay, so that the cut-point does not occur At the maximum energy point.median below iOffset = rgiOffset[i/2] - cOffset; even more robust : find range of 3 (now 5) that is a mode, Then find the mode within this. I.E. more offsets are 25, 26, or 27 Than any other three consecutive offsets. Then choose the one of 25, 26, or 27 that has the most. This will prevent a single frequent Number from being the offset (sometimes happens for certain vowels And nasals, I think).

member.name: T:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.Waveform.BandpassFilter
member.summary: FIR Bandpass filter, filter waveform or EGG file. The filter which transmits energy in a specified wavelength band But rejects energy above and below. The main function of such a filter in a transmitter is to limit the Bandwidth of the output signal to the minimum necessary to convey data At the desired speed and in the desired form.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Tts.Offline.Htk.TrainingSentenceSet.LabelFreeSplit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Splits the training set into several pieces, the sentence count in each piece will be less than the Given value. This function is usually used to split the training set to perform computation in parallel. Please notice: 1. There is no same label in each piece. 2. The count of training set will be even since the count of CPU is always even. 3. The sentences in each piece will be balance as possible.
member.param: Max sentence count in one piece.
